data.title: Fix #526 segfault when pinning projects
data.body: - Fix #526 segfault when pinning projects by deferred reload project list call

data.title: Ability to fix dependencies instead of showing a warning.
data.body: After copying a scene from one place to another you get tons of "Resource Not Found" in a textedit box. It would be useful to have them as a list with ability to replace them. After replacement, mark green if resource extension matches, yellow if unsure (.res, xml) and red if the types do not match.

data.title: Fix bug help history overwrote by tree item selected call back
data.body:
- Fixed the bug by making sure "_tree_item_selected" not get invoked when selecting class by code
- The bug will crash the editor which is not supposed to. ( It should only mesh up help history ) It might worth further investigation in case deeper bug is hidden.
- Crash happened at line: 

```
if (p_class==edited_class->get_text())
```

data.title: Bump up maximum method binding arguements count from 5 to 9
Fixed resource name not updated when saved in resurce dock
data.body: - by enforcing resource name been updated in "save" or "save as" action

data.title: Fix FixedMaterial uv xform not working bug
data.body:
- Fixed #536 - Bug - Material Properties Editor - UV Xform broken
- The bug is due to order mismatch between uv string array and FixedMaterialTexCoordMode enum

data.title: re-importing skeletons
data.body:
Has to do with the latest re-import enhancement.
To reproduce - import an animated character, reimport once (everything should be ok) and reimport twice (bone poses get messed up)

data.title: export (float,min,max) clamps float to int
data.body:
For example:
export (float,1.1,100) var size = 1.1
will clamp the variable to 1, and ignore the ".1"

Also, as a suggestion, could the int, and float types have a .min, and .max? so I can set that max or min range to basically be ignored, also a variable called infinity could just assume those: (float,1.1,infinity)

data.title: Add support to disable filters in the font
data.body: The title says everything.

data.title: Bug - Material Properties Editor - UV Xform broken?
data.body:
I wanted to change scaling of detail texture so I changed mapping from UV to UV Xform but then whole object turned to single color, even when Xform in Params was standard identity matrix.

So I tried to edit this Xform, changed "1" to bigger or smaller values but it had no effect on texture.

Two bugs or one?

data.title: Material Properties Editor - Detail Mix can't display values >1
data.body:
I can use values bigger than 1 for Detail Mix, which is very useful, but if I do property is till displayed as 1 even if it isn't.

Minor bug but annoying when you want to tweak it and you have to remember all values hehe :)

data.title: Bug - Scene Import - sRGB to Linear option not respected by importer
data.body:
Scene Import converts textures from sRGB to Linear space even when option is turned OFF.

In material properties when I Re-import texture, option sRGB to Linear is turned ON, when I turn it OFF and re-import, texture is reimported correctly.

data.title: Command-line functionality for asset import (e.g. COLLADA to Godot scene)
data.body:
I've been thinking about a few things that would speed up content workflows very dramatically (but I just haven't had the time to build any prototypes, unfortunately). Currently, the content workflow for 3D assets is set up as follows:
1.  A designer/modeler/animator develops a new asset (or changes an existing one) using a 3D modeling/animation tool.
2. The new or modified asset is exported as either a single COLLADA scene or one or more OBJs.
3. The exported COLLADA file or OBJ file(s) are then converted to Godot scene(s) by launching Godot and using an "import" dialog.
4. If the asset is a new asset, it is then referenced or copied into the node tree of another scene, but if it's an already existing asset, Godot detects the change and allows you to reload the referenced scene easily.

Most of this is just fine and enables a little basic automation (for example, Blender can be configured to export models with a preset, and the referenced scene reloading in Godot is simple and convenient), but the biggest (and most time consuming) thing standing in the way of fully automating the process is the lack of a command-line conversion ("import") utility that accomplishes what the scene import dialog does.

If Godot had such a command-line interface, teams could easily set up watch utilities (such as a [GulpJS + gulp-watch](https://www.npmjs.org/package/gulp-watch) script) to automatically convert modified COLLADA files into Godot scenes (and maybe backup the new files upon conversion).

This reduces content changes down to a very quick:
1. **Export the COLLADA file and wait a second or two** for a watch script to convert the exported scene (from a COLLADA file to a Godot scene) using Godot's command-line conversion utility.
2. When your (already launched) Godot instance notices the file changed on disk, **click to reload!**

data.title: Default font in editor is non-unicode
data.body: If assign unicode font to Control, it appears in left side of screen (after hitting Enter) but doesn't appears in node properties inspector while writing text. Also one needs to create custom font for this, and assign it to every new Control. It is also not possible to use non-unicode text anywhere in the editor without recompiling.

data.title: Font preview in import dialog file browser
data.body: Font preview in import dialog file browser, like in Blender. Would be handy :)

data.title: Crash after 'undo'
data.body: I pressed Ctrl-Z twice (not fast, one time, then again) and editor crashed. Version 1.0dev from 11 June, system - Windows XP SP3. I was not able to reproduce this again, but the address of instruction was given: `0x00C6EC47`. It tried to read from `0` address. Maybe somebody map it to source and find the cause.

data.title: Godot is forcing to use file extensions during Linux Export
data.body:
linux dont rely on file extensions to handle files but on magic number. There's no need to force an extension on the executable when you export

Thanks

data.title: Make Linux and OSX binaries executable on export
data.body: file doesnt get proper +x permission on export

data.title: segfault when pinning projects
data.body: I am getting segmentation faults in the latest build of Godot for Linux when I pin or unpin a project. The pin/unpin does take effect, and it doesn't segfault every single time, but most of the time. No other errors appear in the terminal output. Tested on two different PCs.

data.title: Skybox rotation support
data.body: Mostly useful in Y axis to change direction of the sun, but probably someone in future will find use case for other axis as well. :)

data.title: Build Error (VS 2008)
data.body:
I've been getting the following trivial build error after the last 2 source pulls using Visual Studio 2008 (9.0) express on MS Windows 7.0:

tools\editor\plugins\baked_light_baker.cpp(313) : error c2666: 'pow' : 6 overloads have similar conversions

Fortunately, its easily fixed by changing the second parameter of the 'pow' function on that line to an int - but I thought i'd better let someone know.

data.title: Search filesystem by name or path
data.body:
- Remove file extension filter, it can be achieve by enter ".EXT", much easier
- Add filter by file name/file path or folder
  ![](http://i59.tinypic.com/2199c2f.jpg)
- Use "close" icon for clear search term button

data.title: Bug - Transform widgets broken in orthogonal view mode
data.body: If you use orthogonal mode in 3D view, transform widgets displayed graphical representation doesn't match selection area. You need to move mouse in random places around widget to find "grabable" place.

data.title: Cube map importer
data.body:
We need cube maps importer :)

PS
Note for users.
If you want to add cube map, current Cube Map Resource is broken, just move your 6 textures to project and add text file with .cube extension, place in it names of your textures separated with Return (Enter). See 3D platformer demo for more.

data.title: Light Bake not rendering correctly in Game Preview
data.body:
Image:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/31390469/Image%20Bin/shadowsbugs.jpg

Project files:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/31390469/controllers.zip

Summary:
If you open scene you will see that boxes have pink error texture, if you rebake light they will be gone, but only in 3D view. Game Preview will still display pink.
I'm not sure what caused this, ESM patch or it was present earlier and because I rotated small cubes with directional light together, to match new skybox, it exposed this bug. Unfortunately I lost undo so I couldnt check it :/

data.title: Different shadows scale in 3D view and Game Preview
data.body:
Image:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/31390469/Image%20Bin/shadowsbugs.jpg

Project files:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/31390469/controllers.zip

Summary:
Before ESM patch shadows looked like the one in the Editor View, now Editor has right scale but Game Preview have different, smaller resolution. It doesn't matter filter even None filter has wrong scale.
